course.subject: MATH
course.name: Calculus and Linear Algebra
course.description: This course teaches basic application techniques in single-variable calculus and linear algebra. Key topics include: systems of linear equations and matrices, functions and graphing, derivatives and optimization, integration and applications.
course.exclusions: Level 5* or above in HKDSE Mathematics Extended Module M1 or M2; grade B or above in HKCEE Additional Mathematics, a passing grade in AS Mathematics and Statistics, AL/AS Applied Mathematics, or in AL Pure Mathematics; MATH 1012; MATH 1013; MATH 1014; MATH 1018 (prior to 2013-14); MATH 1020; MATH 1023; MATH 1024

reviews.author: Tiana
reviews.title: add oil and don't lose hope :)
reviews.comment_content:
Teaching schedule
before midterm1
-financial math
-matrices

before midterm2
-differentiation

before final
integration

This course covers basic calculus. Content is not very difficult (if you work hard) but teaching pace is fast. Constant effort is needed to catch up. Every topics are covered in HKDSE. You life are easier if you have learnt it before.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Xiong
At the beginning, he just read out everything from the powerpoint. Attending lessons doesn't help much. It is the same if you read it yourself. But after midterm1, he conducted class survey and there are apparent changes in teaching method. Instead of reading powerpoint,he writes everything step by step on the whiteboard and makes it easier to follow. His teaching and accent aren't really good but I would say he do care about our feelings and learning.

TA Kitty
She is quite nice and willing to teach you. She prepares her own notes in tutorials. Many exercises are included in tutorials and it do help. Basically if you don't go to lecture and just read the textbook yourself and attend tutorials, you can still perform good in exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
I am a math idiot and just got level 4 in DSE. but finally got an A. Your effort will pay off in this course.

weighting
-7 webworks (10%)
-2 midterms(50%)
-1 final(40%)

My results
-webwork(100%)
-midterm 1 52/80 mean 52
-midterm 2 70/80 mean 5x
-final 88/110 mean 4x
overall got 80.4% -> A
my frd got 74% -> B+
59% -> C+
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload depends on yourself.
Basically, you are required to do 7 webworks(10% )

But for sure 7 webworks are far from enough if you need good grade. Many non-compulsory textbook exercises are assigned for each chapter. Practices makes perfect. I think doing exercises is a important way to learn math.

Some suggestions that may help you in this course. ( You may not agree but just find the way that suits you  most)

-textbook is super expensive,just make sure you have an electronic version (get it form your seniors !!!)

-even if you understand everything in lecture, do some required textbook questions. It is more worthy to do basic questions than some very difficult application problems as the exam only focus on basic concepts.

-if you find the materials too difficult, seek help from TA or go to Math Support Centre( lift3 ,room 3011)
do find a nice person that you feel comfortable with to ask questions. I usually go there when TA Kitty is o duty in MSC. Be proactive and patient in MSC :)

reviews.author: Cp9679
reviews.title: If you want to do well in 1003, its better to do it alone.
reviews.comment_content: Content is easy, but he makes it impossible to understand and you'd be in constant doubt of your math skills previously. But self-learning and just reading lecture notes/YouTube videos would be 1000x more useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: Terrible accent and pronunciation. Cannot make sense of what he's trying to say, let alone teach. Especially worse when topics become slightly complicated. Overall horrible teaching.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is alright as long as you know your content and practice enough.
reviews.comment_workload: Homework and problem sets are quite easy as long as you know what you're doing. Some questions are quite repetitive as well.

reviews.author: cancan
reviews.title: Not too difficult even without learning M1/M2: Very difficult final
reviews.comment_content: Mainly about Annuity, Matrices and Limits and Integration. Since I did not have to learn Integration by Parts (which I heard is the most difficult chapter of the course), the content is not too hard. If you do enough practice, you'll breeze through the course with ease.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His accent makes it quite hard for us to understand what he is saying. If you're sleepy, you'll certainly fall asleep quickly after hearing him talk for 15 minutes (or less!) because he also speaks very slowly.

His slides are organized quite poorly since he can easily reduce the number of slides by not including the pop-ups. (If you don't understand what I meant, Slide 10 is basically Slide 9 with one more point and Slide 11 is Slide 10 with one more point. He could easily only include Slide 11 only!). You can skip his lectures since he's just reading the slides and write your own notes.

But what saved him from an E is that he tries his best to answer all the questions in the group chat and uploads the answers for the problem sets promptly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Weighting
Problem Sets:10%
MT:30%
Final:60%
The grading is curve-based and the 10% for the problem sets are basically free since he uploads the answers for them. However, I cannot understand why I lost some marks in the test and final as no answers were uploaded.

The MT is 3 LQs and the final is 20 MCQ and 3 LQ. The midterm has a mean of 23.3/40 and the SD is 9.0.

Update: The final has 2 parts for MCQs and 3 LQs. The mean for the 2 parts of the MCQs were 11/20 and the mean for the 3 LQs are around 8-9/20.
reviews.comment_workload: Light since you only have to work on 7 problem sets throughout the semester. The answers will be given so you can afford to be a deadline fighter.

Professor Ku is kind
Professor Ku can't speak English right
Professor Ku is lovely

No one goes to the maths lecture haha jokes on him
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm make up for 30% of the course
highest's 57 lowest's 13 mean's thirty something
Final make up for 60%
highest 97 lowest 0 idk wts the mean
Homework make up for 10% of overall grade
Just submit it promptly and you'll be fine
I have 90.8% in overall and that's around A
I heard from my senior friend that if u want an A+ then u need to score 95% in overall
Reading the comments below I think u would get an A if u score above 87%
If u score around mean I think it gets u B Since the grading is relatively more pleasant than common core
reviews.comment_workload:
I dropped m2 in early f4 and know basically nothing except for the differentiation part. Relatively easier compare to dse m2 syllabus(no trigo and proving). I would say that completing all the webwork would get u good grade if u are doing it ALL BY URSELF, probably b+ or a-.
If u want an A or A-, you would have to complete some after chapter exercises. Maybe just five long questions each chapter, it is more than enough for u to prepare for exams as the pattern of exam questions is repetitive. Just ditch all the maths lectures cuz it's useless, if you are shit at maths, go to the maths tutorials, msc and find urself a frd that is gd at maths. And you must be sensational towards the question during exam in order to apply a correct approach. Peace ✌🏻.

reviews.author: celina
reviews.comment_content: The powerpoint is clear, shows the concepts and steps. Revision can be done by just learning from the powerpoint. However, some solutions of the problems are solved in classes. If you do not attend the classes, you may miss some solutions.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor just reads from the powerpoint, not really useful teaching. The class is a little bit noisy.
reviews.comment_grading: The medium grade is around the grade of B-.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload, don't take attendance. No homework needed to be handed in at all. Some pratice problems will be shown in the powerpoint, but they do not have to be handed in.

reviews.author: ssw1234
reviews.title: 有耐心且教導清晰的好老師
reviews.comment_content:
金融數學:
2.1 Simple Interest
2.2 Compound Interest, Growth and Time
2.3 Future Value of an Annuity, Sinking Fund
2.4 Present Value of an Annuity, Amortization

矩陣:
3.1 System of Linear Equations in 2 Variables
3.2 Augmented Matrices
3.3 Gauss-Jordan Elimination and Applications
3.4 Matrices, Addition and Subtraction, Multiplication
3.5 Inverse of a Matrix
3.6 Matrix Equations
3.7 Leontief Input-Output Analysis

微積分:
8.1, 8.4 Rate of Change, Slope of the Tangent Line, Derivative
8.5 Differentiation Properties, Power Rule
9.1 Continuous Compound Interest
9.2 Derivative of Exponential Function and Logarithmic Function
9.3 Product Rule and Quotient Rule
9.4 Chain Rule
9.5 Implicit Differentiation
9.6 Related Rates
10.1 First Derivative and Graph
10.2 Second Derivative and Graph
8.2 Infinite Limits and Limits at Infinity
10.4 Curve-Sketching
10.5 Absolute Maxima and Minima
10.6 Optimization
11.1 Anti-derivatives and Indefinite Integrals
11.2 Integration by Substitution
11.4 Definite Integrals
11.5 Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
11.6 Area Between Curves

課題繁多但每章節只有十數頁的內容。微積分部份的內容是連貫的。
reviews.comment_teaching: Yao Jing的教導非常詳細。遇到任何問題，她都歡迎你透過電郵或下課後問他。她會主動認識學生和了解學習需求。課後亦提供了許多練習和模擬試卷。
reviews.comment_grading:
Online homework
mean 約90%
online homework因為可提交至答案完全正確，所以基本上全部人都能夠取得滿分。

Midterm
mean 69% uq 85%
內容只涵蓋金融數學和矩陣。考試內容有12題MC（各佔5%）和2題LQ (各佔20%）。難度偏淺。

Final exam
mean 66%
內容只涵蓋微積分。考試內容有10題mc（各佔4%）和4題lq (共佔60%）。難度屬簡單。

My grade: A+
10/10 + 23.75/25 (95%) + 65/65 (100%) = 98.75%
由於今年試卷難度偏淺，很多同學都考獲高的分數。我的朋友在final exam僅錯了一題MC便只有A。同學必須在midterm後的微積分部份多加努力，這部分對總成績有重要影響。
reviews.comment_workload:
10% Online homework
25% Midterm
65% Final exam

基本上只有兩個考試加六份homework. Homework在網上接受無限次提交答案。每份大約須完成1小時。因此工作量非常低。

reviews.comment_teaching:
In lectures:
Excellent teaching, but sometimes we must all agree on the fact that his accent is a bit strong and somehow affects the delivery of course materials.

No one can say no to the fact that he is such a charming professor. His voice, his smile and his humour, have all contributed to the success in retaining ~20% of all students in the lecture hall.

After-class support:
He has tried really hard, I mean REALLY hard, to help us pass the course. He held Zoom meetings just for helping us score full marks in assignments. He even helped us solve the problem if we still couldn't figure out the answer after trying multiple times. He had conducted a review session on Zoom before the final exam. Do feel the work he's prepared for us. So, he definitely doesn't deserve an E in the teaching part.
reviews.comment_grading:
WeBwork (10%) --> 100/100

Mid-term exam (25%) --> 22/30
(Mean = 14.9 out of 30
Median = 14 out of 30
S.D. = 5.7 out of 30)

Final exam (65%) --> 78/120
(Mean = 49.0 out of 120
Median = 47 out of 120
S.D. = 24.0 out of 120)
"The final exam performance is much worse than I expected.  I will probably make some adjustment to the passing marks." - Professor Albert Ku

Letter Grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload. Webwork is required, 10% towards the grade. Easy to handle and easy to score 100%.

reviews.author: CHENYIHENG
reviews.comment_content: The course includes financial math,matrix, derivatives and anti-derivatives. All of them are very basic contents.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very nice and most of class time is doing example questions. If you focus a lot during the class time, you will find the content very easy.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Web work: finish on time
50% midterm: 2 midterms with a middle difficulty
40% final: seems to be more difficult than midterms, so please do more practices and do not be nervous.
reviews.comment_workload: If you review the material and do example questions on time, you can do really well. (light workload)

very conscientious
very welcome students to ask questions after class. personally I have asked lots of time.

reviews.comment_workload:
There are 7 homework sets.

reviews.author: Dinner
reviews.title: 對於一向數學都唔得嘅人黎講都算幾難
reviews.comment_content:
midterm之前教嘅嘢都ok簡單，考midterm前會upload啲sample exam，識做sample exam嘅話其實midterm唔太難

final啲內容就好難，根本上完全唔明做緊咩，最後考完都唔知道考左咩
reviews.comment_teaching: 冇咩點上堂，因為成日將啲好簡單嘅嘢講到好複雜，YouTube自學好啲
reviews.comment_grading: 最後c+左都算係預左
reviews.comment_workload:
都有好幾份功課，因為本身對數學就唔太識，所以每份都做左好耐，不過其實問下其他同學或者有啲人會share啲step出黎，雖然要好多時間，不過都會做到

final同midterm都OK嘅，考之前努力操下都算係有啲用，不過final因為佢短時間內教左好多嘢，所以都要多啲時間操

reviews.author: jasonhon
reviews.title: If you can finish webwork by yourself, you can do well in the midterm and final
reviews.comment_content:
Mid-term: Finance and Matrices
Final: Derivatives and Integration
(Integration by Parts is not included in this semester)
Derivatives of Trigonometric Functions are not included in the syllabus.
you can find some notes and by-topic reviews on this website
https://www.math.hkust.edu.hk/~mamsxiong/1003Notes/schedule-2017Fall-MonFri.html
reviews.comment_teaching: Although I think Dr WU may be not a bad instructor, I still recommend you can skip most of the lectures and tutor. Since the content is not difficult to understand, you can just by reading the lecture notes, take a look at the hand-written and do the webwork to understand everything in the course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork(10%) mean: ~80-93
Midterm(25%) mean: 67.13
Final(65%) mean: 64.15
Total mean: 67.33
My grade: A+ (98.75%)
reviews.comment_workload:
Total 7 Webwork Homework
I would say the workload depends on your understanding and your aim for this course.
If you ended up still can not get the answer, you can try to send Prof. an e-mail to seek help. If it is some questions that she did not mention in class, she probably will provide some hand-written help.
If you don't care about understanding, you can just do it by using an online calculator and asking google. Then you can finish one webwork in less than 30 mins.

reviews.author: stephhhxx
reviews.comment_content: The lecture notes is quite easy to understand but the exam's content is slightly difficult than what they teach in class, so make sure you can understand the mathematical theory behind but not just solely memorizing the notes. Then you can pass this course easily! Professor is willing to explain the questions from students after class! :)
reviews.comment_teaching: He's so nice and willing to answer students's questions. Always encourage student to finish the homework before the deadline, he is one of the best professor in UST I would say!
reviews.comment_grading:
Below mean in mid-term but still can get a C overall!
The midterm is a bit rush and don't have enough of time to finish, but for the final exam, you surely have enough of time!
Don't give up!
reviews.comment_workload: the online hw is accountable for the final grade so better score high and work hard on this, even it's just 10%.

reviews.author: Unknown_
reviews.title: You'll secure A range if u study hard
reviews.comment_content:
Same as the course name. It's really Calculus and Linear Algebra.

Before the mid-term, all financial calculations e.g. Present Value, Future Value and Annuity together with the matrix.

After mid-term, all about calculus.

The content is, of course, boring - unless you are fond of mathematics, or else I can't see any use of learning calculus in my life.

The content is not easy, but you need to pay hard work.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Don't have too much expectation on math professors. Basically, Math professors speak slowly. Their English may not be too eloquent due to their high IQ in logic thinking instead I guess. However, math professors are the warmest and most friendly ones. I guess you know what I mean.

But anyway, Albert's teaching and delivery are understandable. Zhang even sent out answers before WebBook due date which helped me, a math idiot a lot.

For tutorials, I will say I have never attended any tutorials since I really can't get some words of what the tutor was saying. He is really really a nice guy but sorry to say that.


For math, if u think the teaching speed is too slow - I watched all the 16 lectures I skipped by 2x in 3 days before the exam. And it's fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
To be honest, the grading is lenient.

I believe if I work harder(do exercises and watch all lectures on time rather than rush), I can obtain a better grade. Your grade depends on your hard work.
reviews.comment_workload:
7 Webworks
1 midterm
1 final

reviews.author: T.Lo
reviews.title: P/F jor
reviews.comment_content:
The content was simple with it being divided into 3 big topics:
1. Interest,
2. Matrix,
3. Calculus.
There seems to have been a pretty fair divide between the time spent on all of the topics. It is a satisfy content
reviews.comment_teaching: Heavy accent, difficult to see what he is writing on the white board
reviews.comment_grading: Due to the semester change from offline to online all in a sudden. Hence, the school allowed Pass or Fail option. Math1003 is the only course that allow this option. I chose Pass or Fail and resulting a pass. That's why I think quite good.
reviews.comment_workload: Not heavy

reviews.author: ustkatielaw
reviews.comment_content: there are three major topics throughout this course: Interest Rates, Matrix and Calculus. As a DSE student who didn't take M1/2, I found the difficulty of the concepts and questions to be OK. Wasn't too hard (poor 1013 people) really if you spent time on the lecture notes and exercises.
reviews.comment_teaching: Just don't bother going to the lectures. I started skipping them after like the second week of the semester. Everyone does the same as you can see the size of the class being halved every week lol. The professor had a really bad Mainland accent and is difficult to understand. Just reading from his lecture notes will suffice to understand everything in the course. Didn't even bothering going to the tutorial as well lol.
reviews.comment_grading:
The course had Midterm and Final exams. They are not that hard and are pretty straightforward, especially for the final exam (which was conducted online). Pretty good grading in my opinion given that you are well-prepared for the exams.


Midterm: 58/60
Final: 56/60 (I think)
Webwork: Full (everyone gets full marks so...)
overall: A+
reviews.comment_workload: Not much really. I didn't go to the lectures and just reviewed the lecture notes and PowerPoint after class by myself. If you got caught up in other commitments, studying for this course 1 week prior would still suffice. I would say the Webwork is the major workload in this course since some of the questions are quite tricky. Just watch out for the deadlines and be prepared to spend ~1 hour on each of them. Go to math support centre if you need help on those questions lol

reviews.author: ThisIsMe
reviews.comment_content: The content was pretty simple with it being divided into three main sections: Interest, Matrix, and Calculus. There seems to have been a pretty fair divide between the time spent on all of the topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: I would for sure not recommend this professor as I only attended 2 lectures throughout the whole semester. The times I attended, I felt like I was losing knowledge as opposed to gaining knowledge. For the tutorials, I only went when I had questions about a topic as the TA usually uploaded a worksheet of questions with their answers online and just explained how to do those questions during the tutorial.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was fair as it largely constituted of the grades given for the mid-term and finals. However, we do have to complete sets of WebWorks throughout the semester which do count for our grade. The mid-term is based on matrices and interest related questions, while the final exam is based completely on calculus as there were many chapters on calculus covered.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fine as throughout the semester we only had to complete WebWorks for the topics and they usually only contained on average 10-13 questions.

reviews.author: cheikei
reviews.title: class that really shouldn't be as difficult as it turned out to be, I am so relieved im done with it
reviews.comment_content: Content is probably not difficult if you have good notions of calc. Which I had absolutely not. so it was a STRUGGLE for me even by bingewatching youtube & Khan Academy. I think if you're good at grasping concepts on your own/ just by reading the book you should be fine. Don't give up halfway like me but then panic when you realize the exam is coming and cram the whole syllabus in the last few weeks. lmao
reviews.comment_teaching: I know this was his first year at UST but his teaching (if reading off the textbook and writing out the answers to examples with practically zero/ absolutely incomprehensible explanations qualifies as teaching) was honestly not helpful at all (LOL understatement of the year). Basically everyone skipped after the first week. Better use of your time to self-study and learn the concepts via the internet than wasting two hours in a lecture and coming out of there even more confused than when you walked in.
reviews.comment_grading: the curve saved me. I have no idea how I didn't fail--biggest miracle of 2018. but I ain't complaining
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is really ok. Just make sure you turn in the webwork on time and don't miss any of them. Also SELF PRACTICE or attend the tutorials to get more practice problems in.

reviews.author: abpuma
reviews.comment_content:
This course teaches basic application techniques in single-variable calculus and linear algebra.

Key topics include: systems of linear equations and matrices, functions and graphing, derivatives and optimization, integration and applications.

Assessment:
Online homework (WeBWork): 10%
Midterm Exam: 30 %
Final Exam: 60 %.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He's an extremely boring teacher and his English is not good. He speaks softly and seems confused sometimes. But, he uploads his slides and video lectures online so, there's no need to go to his class. Practice the questions on his slides.

WebWork is a mix of very easy and very difficult questions. Be prepared for a difficult mid-term and final.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is not too strict but it depends on how well the class has performed. For us, the mid-term and final were very difficult but the mean was quite high. I scored above the mean in both, just short of 1 SD. I got B+.
reviews.comment_workload: There will be about 6-7 webworks. They are uploaded at regular intervals and the deadline is usually 10-14 days away (which is more than enough to complete it). The workload is quite average. Keep practicing regularly.

reviews.author: Flying donkey
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite boring.
She just read from ppt and her accent makes me hard to understand at the beginning.
The examples given in lesson are easy to understand and quite similar to the exam questions.
The best thing about the lesson is she would solve the problem step by step and the pace is slow, which give me more time to figure out what’s happening.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair. The exam questions are very similar to the problem from tutorial worksheets. If you can finish the web work problems + problems provided on tutorial class +some questions from book, then u can get good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: More practice can definitely help you to get a better grade.

reviews.author: smallpotatoes
reviews.comment_content: It is super similar to DSE M2 syllabus so it is not very hard.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor teaches very well, he explained the concepts clearly but the course content is not that difficult so if you can understand the PPT slides and can finish the exercise given by your own. Then skipping the lessons is not a problem.

The professor is also willing to help if you come to his office or find him after lecture.

Yup skip all tutorials!
reviews.comment_grading:
Easy if you have done the past paper provided by professor before.

Webwork (10%): 800/800
Midterm (30%): 74/80 (92.5%)
Final (60%): 136/160 (85%)
Weighted overall: 88.75%

Grade: A

reviews.author: 也許不必知道我是誰
reviews.comment_content:
The course covers mathematics for finance (some concepts like present value, future value and annuity etc.), matrix, differentiation and integration. As most of the students taking this course are business students, the syllabus also covers some applications of the mathematical concepts, like two-industries models and marginal analysis in economics. The content in this course can hence be applied in other business core courses, for example, I found the mathematics for finance particularly useful in accounting course, which covers the computation of bonds' present value.

Although some examples covered in differentiation and integration require the use of calculators, Mid-term 2 (just testing differentiation) and Final Exam (testing differentiation and integration) mainly examine your ability to apply the concepts taught. Those questions do not appear in these exams, hence no calculators are allowed.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Li will do some proof and steps on the white board for some difficult mathematical concepts and examples in class, so that we can have more thorough understanding about the content. However, he is not always able to make verbal explanations of the concepts clearly. If you have no idea about what he is talking about, referring to the white board might be a good choice for you.

TA is Kitty. She makes her own tutorial notes, including some crucial formulas and concepts for each topic, followed by a lot of exercises. The tutorial notes are pretty useful and she will put the solution of the exercises on her own webpage. She will also go through some questions to clear our misunderstandings. In spite of her low voice which makes the tutorials a bit boring, I still think that attending the tutorials is beneficial to you.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:
10% WebWork
25% Each mid-term, 2 in total
40% Final Exam

Some statistics for the exams:
Mid-term 1
Mean: 55.87/80  SD: 13.23
Mid-term 2
Mean: 49.68/80  SD: 16.83
Final Exam
Mean: 54.06/105  SD: 18.77

Completed all WebWork with full credits and got 65/80, 63/80 and 71/105 in three exams. Overall score is just about 1 SD above the mean. Final grade is A-. The grading is extremely generous for a mathematics course.
reviews.comment_workload: There are only 8 WebWork in the whole semester as our assignments, but the questions are quite challenging. Some questions are very similar to the examples in class but some are really complicated. As I do the WebWork for my own practice very often (instead of copying...), sometimes I have to go to Math Support Centre or ask the TA after tutorials for their assistance.

reviews.author: Crockett
reviews.comment_content:
Before mid-term: Financial mathematics, similar to Geometric sequence learned in DSE and matrix operation.
Final: only the calculus part is tested.
Derivative topics include: limits, differentiating rules, first, and second derivatives, maxima/minima, inflection point, and their graphs.
Integration topics include: integration by substitution, the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, the definite integral, area between curves.
As you can see this is the most basic course provided by the math department so the content is designed to be easily grasped for people who haven't learned any calculus before.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is a nice lady who answers students' questions in detail.
However, her powerpoint is poorly organized. For instance, the next slide is exactly the same as the previous with one more sentence. If you want to have a more organized one, download other professors' slides on the internet.
For tutorials, the TA will give you some questions to practice. I think some questions are quite challenging and will further your knowledge on the topics. However, I don't think you will miss anything if you do not go to tutorials.
reviews.comment_grading: Not much opinion on this matter, as far as I can tell is that ~90% will secure you A range.
reviews.comment_workload:
only 7 webwork in total. Some questions in webwork are more difficult than the problems in the exam, so webwork can be a test for your understanding.
Apart from the questions demonstrated in lecture slides, you can find extra problems in the textbook. I have a lot of spare time and I have done all of them.

All assignments have unlimited attempts, so try your best to complete all of them.

I got 20/30 for the mid-term exam, the mean is 15.1/30. It is an exam with 15 MC questions.

For the final exam, I put huge effort on revising and  drilling papers and I was quite satisfied my answers after the exam ended. However, when the grades were released, I was quite disappointed. Therefore, hardwork is needed but don’t expect too much to achieve high grades.

Overall grade: B
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is adequate. There are 7 assignments in total.

reviews.author: Smurfing in UST
reviews.title: Easy course yet many still cannot get high score
reviews.comment_content:
It is literally high school level calculus (DSE M2)

Basically consists of four parts:
1. Mathematics of finance (simple interest, compound interest, annuity, sinking fund...)
2. Matrix
3. Differentiation
4. Integration

This course is just an introduction to calculus, designated for students without a calculus background. The content is not hard. It takes me some time to learn related rates and optimisation. If you can manage this two, you will feel easy for the remaining content.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Zhang Weizhong has a strong accent and I cannot understand what he was talking about at first. Also, he is poor at making ppt. He does not know how to add animation in ppt so he adds a page of ppt for a new bullet point.

However, Zhang is very responsible and devoted to his teaching. He tries to answer every question from students in the WhatsApp group and explain every homework question.
reviews.comment_grading:
Components:
10% Webwork homework
(unlimited attempts, so you can try until you get 100%, this part gives free scores)
25% midterm
(20MC questions about mathematics of finance, and matrix)
65% final exam
(20MC questions and 4 LQs, about calculus)

Fair grading
10% homework, mean 9.32/10, I get 10/10
25% midterm, mean about 15/30, I get 18/30
65% final, mean 49/120, I get 63/120.

Overall slightly above the mean and result in a B grade. Quite fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
Moderate workload.

6 assignments, each consisting of 8-12 questions. It costs me around 2 hours to get 100% on each homework. Zhang will give answers and explanations for the homework before the deadline so don't worry too much about it.

The midterm was 75-minute long, it is inadequate. You have to prepare well for it, including the knowledge and MC skills.
The final takes 3 hours. It is just enough for me. Prepare for it too.

Moreover, the tutorial is not mandatory. I only attend 2 throughout the semester.

reviews.author: tyeeee
reviews.comment_content: Comprised of M1 (differenciation), M2 (matrix) and interest stuff.
reviews.comment_teaching: His intonation makes the lecture lesson boring and I almost skipped all lectures (except those lectures from Sep) Nevertheless, we can ask questions in the Whatsapp group, which is  super useful during final exam period and when the Webwork's deadline is closed.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think not too bad indeed.
i got 62/120 in the final (mean 49/120), but eventually ending up a B+ grade, probably bcoz I did well in midterm and got full marks in Webwork.
reviews.comment_workload:
Moderate workload.
The course consists of 1 final, 1 midterm and 7 Webworks.

reviews.author: iloveecon
reviews.title: Average teaching but with detailed explanation of each questions
reviews.comment_content:
2.1 Simple Interest     
2.2 Compound Interest, Growth and Time
2.3 Future Value of an Annuity, Sinking Fund
2.4 Present Value of an Annuity, Amortization   
3.1 System of Linear Equations in 2 Variables
3.2 Augmented Matrices
3.3 Gauss-Jordan Elimination and Applications   
3.4 Matrices, Addition and Subtraction, Multiplication
3.5 Inverse of a Matrix   
3.6 Matrix Equations
3.7 Leontief Input-Output Analysis
8.1, 8.4 Rate of Change, Slope of the Tangent Line, Derivative
8.5 Differentiation Properties, Power Rule   
9.1 Continuous Compound Interest   
9.2 Derivative of Exponential Function and Logarithmic Function
9.3 Product Rule and Quotient Rule   
9.4 Chain Rule
9.5 Implicit Differentiation   
9.6 Related Rates   
10.1 First Derivative and Graph
10.2 Second Derivative and Graph
8.2 Infinite Limits and Limits at Infinity
10.4 Curve-Sketching
10.5 Absolute Maxima and Minima   
10.6 Optimization
11.1 Anti-derivatives and Indefinite Integrals   
11.2 Integration by Substitution   
11.4 Definite Integrals
11.5 Fundamental Theorem of Calculus   
11.6 Area Between Curves
14.3 Integration by Parts (skipped, not enough time to teach)  

For math1003, I think the content covered is too less and simple than other math courses which is not in-depth enough. But, it is understandable that this course is for those who doesn't have m1/2 background, including me. However, I think this course could include more content like methods for evaluating limits, l'hospital rule etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: I would say his teaching does not have any special. One good thing about him is that he explains detailly for each questions on the powerpoint slides which is a good thing for math idiots like me. Also, he is also very willing to answer questions even though that question seems dumb. However, his tone is king of monotone and boring which will be easily fell asleep. Fortunately, my class is a zoom class so you can skip the lessons. For me, I skipped the lessons since integration because it is manageable to read the book and powerpoint slides in canvas. And I know some friends skipped his lessons since lesson 2 but they still got A+ so it is not necessary to go to the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online homework (WeBWork): 10 %(me:100/100)
basically, everyone can get full marks in webwork because there are unlimited attempts which allows us to guess the answer for many times.
Midterm Exam: 25 %(me:20/30, mean:14.9, median:14, sd:5.7)
Final Exam: 65%(me:89/120, mean:49, median:47, sd:24)
For the midterm exam, all questions are mc and many questions doesn't require us to calculate, instead it is asking concepts so many of us couldn't answer the questions. Make sure to grasp the concepts well.
For the final exam, make sure to check carefully for the long questions because one question constitutes for 20 marks which is important to your final mark. I perform worse in mc because I just got above mean little in mc but in long questions I got way higher than the mean for almost 40 marks. So check your long questions and I would say long questions are the easiest in the final because they are very standard which are the same as past paper. I recommend you to practice more for curve sketching because there must be a long question each year and also for the evaluation of the indefinite integrals, definite integrals and area between curves because past paper has these type of questions as well and basically they are very mechanical which means practice makes perfect. This will ensure you to gain a lot of marks in this course.
Final grading: A- only because my mc performs worse in final and some careless mistakes in long questions. Overall percentage: 75%
reviews.comment_workload:
very light workload with only 7 webworks and each webworks has 2 weeks for us to do, so enough time to finish. Also, the questions are simple which one webwork only takes around 30 minutes to finish. Also, if you don't know any questions, you can go to math support center to ask for help, just in case you need it.
The workload comes from the preparation of midterm and final because he will give you a list of self-practice questions from the textbook and also suggested solutions which involves many questions. So spare some time to finish the self-practice questions for a good grade. However, I would say self-practice questions for matrix is kind of useless because the midterm about matrix is all conceptual questions and only involves little application problems like Leontief Input-Output Analysis. Do practice more curve sketching, optimization problems, indefinite integrals, definite integrals and finding area between curves.

reviews.author: whoeveriam
reviews.comment_content:
-review others la
-basically just the M2 things (e.g. matrice, present/future value, limits...etc)
reviews.comment_teaching:
-His teaching is really bad so don't expect too much
-Strong accent so can't really understand what he says
-skipping his lectures since week 2 lmao
-YET, he tries his very best to let us pass Math 1003 which I appreciate such as holding zoom meetings before the ddl of submitting webwork to solve questions together
reviews.comment_grading:
10%-webwork x 7
25%-midterm (MC) (mean: 15/30)
65%-final (mean: 49/120)

The midterm is full of lots of conceptual questions and you wouldn't know how to do if you don't know the concepts. Also for the midterm, you have to complete 15 MCs in 40 minutes which the time is not enough and you have to be really rush.

For final, well it is really hard (as you can see the mean is 49/120 lol)There are 20 MC and 4 long questions final. Each long question counts for 20 marks.....If you don't know how to do one of the long questions, 20 marks is gone....
reviews.comment_workload:
A bit heavy I would say coz you have to hand in the webwork once per 2 weeks
And in almost the end of semester, you have to hand in once per week

reviews.author: fta_22
reviews.comment_content: the normal basic math for business student. should be okay for people who has taken a level or smth
reviews.comment_teaching:
his english is okay i guess compared to the other math teacher but don't expect much. its better of you just self study.

the TA are okay, very helpfull with homework
reviews.comment_grading: the grading idk tbh, still confused if this course is curve or normal. but the score that the prof gave is okay i guess for most people (pretty objective)
reviews.comment_workload: normal, there is homework after each topic. if you dont understand you can ask, he will give a clue sometimes

reviews.author: wuman1012
reviews.comment_content: basic linear algebra, including inverse matrix and system of linear equations. Basic Calculus including differentiation rules and implicit differentiation. TVM concepts (Annuity, PV and FV) . Little Integration (example of Lorenz curve and substitution method...)
reviews.comment_teaching: Clear explanation over each topic and he is willing to answer student's questions.
reviews.comment_grading: just fair maybe since math course normally is curve-based and the std of final exam is about twenty somethings.
reviews.comment_workload: very light workload,  should be about the homework assignment only, which account for 10% of total weighting and can be finish and get full mark easily.

reviews.author: abcdefgh
reviews.title: seriously..?
reviews.comment_content: Basically about finance math like annuity, matrix, differential and integral calculus. the intro part was manageable but the latter half was so challenging. Finance math was quite useful because u r gonna use it in accounting.
reviews.comment_teaching:
WOW. He is a personification of a sleeping pill. His English was so poor that one day during the lecture I found myself almost crying, torturing and exhausted. I mean you will only remember his "hmm" or "umm" after the lecture and i guess about 50% of the entire lecture is consisted of his hmm and umm. I understand math guys can be weak at speaking English fluently. HOWEVER, he is a PROFESSOR!! He basically has a duty to deliver the content clearly as an instructor! He only reads through the PPT during the whole session, and his PPT includes too many unnecessary slides so u will probably spend quite lots of time deleting them during revision. Good luck for those who may take this course or u should feel grateful if the instructors are changed next year.

TA was similar too....
reviews.comment_grading:
webwork-10%
midterm-30%
final-60%

Got B-.

Screwed the midterm but still was able to survive due to the final exam because I got above mean. personally think midterm was slightly harder than final. but if you COMPLETELY understand ppt, webwork questions and any revision materials the prof provides, u will be fine. dont be so nervous if u get lower than expected in the midterm; you can still catch up because mean is not that high. if u find the exam challenging, so do other guys.
reviews.comment_workload: pretty low. u have about 2 weeks to finish one problem set which includes 10~13 questions. the prof uploaded the answer and explanation of webwork questions on canvas (not all of problem sets but something like matrix, integration n differentiation) so dont worry too much. u can also ask confusing questions via whatsapp group.

reviews.author: awong11
reviews.comment_content: the content is fine if you have a decent math background. However it is also important to attend the lectures and keep up to pace with the class.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching can be a bit boring as the professor seemed a bit disinterested at times. It is also hard to hear him speak. I recommend attending the lectures but also looking at other resources online if there are anything else that you don't understand.
reviews.comment_grading: the grading seems fair as you are put up with other people in the class who generally aren't the crazy smart math people. As long as you study well and prepare for the mid term and final, you should be fine.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fine. There is a set of homework assigned every 1-2 weeks, and it is generally just a good review and glimpse into what the midterm and final questions are like.

reviews.author: xfk
reviews.comment_content:
Content is fair, not hard to handle if read through the ppt
Most are M12 content, the questions will not dig too deep if the topic is relatively difficult.
The MC in midterm and final are quite challenging, the mean is not that high. For long questions, some which appear in the exam can be found in homework or past paper. Do past paper!
reviews.comment_teaching:
Patient explanation although purely read ppt slides, accent a bit hard to hear at times
Answers students questions in detail
reviews.comment_grading:
Problem Sets:10%
Midterm:30%
Final exam:60%
reviews.comment_workload: Fair, problem sets have sufficient time but some questions are really challenging

reviews.author: Eli0425
reviews.title: MATH 1003
reviews.comment_content: Very easy, just basic Calculus. The content only covers 1/3 - 1/2 DSE M2 syllabus. Do the textbook questions as Dr. Ku provides the solution. Practice makes Perfect.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Ku is a really good teacher. He explained the concepts at a slow pace. (although he increased the teaching pace after the mid term and held an extra class before final exam)
reviews.comment_grading:
To be honest, I don't know much about the grading, as I cannot retrieve the data from Canvas. As the course is very easy, you may assume the mean, sd is very high.

My final score: 88% out of 100%
Grade= A+
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork homework only, about 8-10 homework in total. You can find TA for help if you meet problems in solving the homework questions. TA will explain the homework ans in each tutorial, no need to attend if u get all correct in the homework.

reviews.author: HIHI1999
reviews.title: Easy Practice Questions, but hard final
reviews.comment_content:
It contains three parts 1) Finance Related Calculation 2) Matrices 3) Linear.

1) Finance Related Calculation
- Simple/ Compound Interest
- Future value and present value

2) Matrices
- Augmented matrices
- Gauss Jordan elimination
- Inverse of a matrix
- Matrix Equation
- Leontief Input-output Analysis

3) Linear
- Differentiation properties
- Implicit differentiation
- First Derivative and its graph
- Second Derivative and its graph
- Local Maxima/ MInima
- Absolute Maxima/ MInima
- Anti-derivatives
- Integrals
reviews.comment_teaching: My lecturer's presentation skills is not good, but I can still understand what he say. Because he talks so slowly, when he teaches me new concepts, it allows me to think, which is good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assessment
- Online homework (WeBWork): 10 %
- Midterm Exam: 30 %
- Final Exam: 60 %

The mid-term is much more easier than the final. However, the MC of both of them are very hard.
The final exam was much more difficult than the past paper he gave us. It contains three LQs, two of which are for the application, and you need to construct the formula yourself, so if you fail at the first problem, the rest of the problems can become dangerous.

I ended up with a C. I messed up MC and LQS that I thought I'd get an F after the exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is fine, 7 WeBWork, 1 midterm and a final.

WeBWork is not hard, as long as you do it after revising your lecture notes.

reviews.author: meowk
reviews.comment_content:
midterm:
-mathematics of finance, and thats interest rates, compound interest etc.
-matrices, application of linear systems

final exam
-differentiations
-integrations

basically its M2 stuffs
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tried both of the professors during add drop period.
For Albert Ku, his pronunciation and accent is better than the other one. Teaching is totally fine and willing to answer questions even during class. Not much extra materials given except for lesson powerpoints and pastpaper. Got a soft copy of the book from the TA of his section :)

For Zhang WeiZhong, he's a nice guy but with special accent. Could be hard to understand sometimes before getting used to it.  He is really helpful in solving our problems. A lot of extra materials compared to Ku Yin Bon, such as providing explanation and answers to the WebWork. Even conducted extra zoom before the final exam just to revise with us.

If you think you can understand Zhang's accent, he is definitely a better prof. in providing resources. Ku's teaching is quite good and easy to understand. Depends on what you aim for but never skip lectures or you will regret. :)
reviews.comment_grading:
Not bad, I finished all the WebWork and took full marks for it, 10% of the final score.

Midterm above mean and final above mean. B+ at last.
Just don't think it is too hard and pay attention during class to secure a good grade. Overall its quite good grading as i was expecting a worse one. Final exam was 0.9 s.d. above.
reviews.comment_workload:
Absolutely fine. Only WebWork with unlimited attempts that will count into 10% of your grade. The others are your exam scores which take up 30% for midterm and 60% for finals.

No attendance required but recommend to attend it.

reviews.author: Bon*2
reviews.title: Work hard and you can get a good grade :)
reviews.comment_content:
The content is quite useful in other courses (Acct 2010)  and it is about the mathematics of finance, matrix, basic differentiation, and integration. Powerpoint is clear for the concept. If you still don't understand, just ask your friends or professors. Clear concepts are a must for A range.
Just try to do as many exercises as you can to get an A. You could find the exercises and answers on canvas.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His English has an accent and speaks a bit slow so just SKIP all the lectures and study the ppt by yourself. Review the lecture videos in case you don't understand the concept in the ppt.
Just remember to attend every tutorial class or review all tutorial classes in case you missed them.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% webwork
30% midterm
60% final

10/10 in webwork
42/60 in midterm
82/100 in final
80.2/100 in overall
I got an A in the end.
I think grading is quite fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite big before the midterm and the final exam as exercises are a MUST. You better attend all tutorials as they help you to clarify most of the concepts and you could ask any questions that popped up to TA. The exercises done in tutorial classes are similar to those which appear in the midterm and final.
Remember to finish all the webwork seriously and do the exercise the professor suggested on Canvas if you want an A. You could try as much as you can until you get the right answer in the webwork. Answers and steps will be shown on Canvas. If you still don't understand, just email the TA. Good Luck!!!!

midterm and final (as long as you complete the practice questions selected from textbook which are not required to hand in, you will be fine for the exams) Both exams are open book -- you can read the slides from canvas.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Ku is a friend professor. His accent is easy to understand and the lecture slides he provided were concise and structured.

He's also very considerate as he will record all of his lecture videos and upload them to Canvas.
So, it's not necessary to attend his f2f lectures. However, I would highly recommend you to go. I think it's better for learning and understanding. However, as Prof. Ku was only reading from his slides, the lessons could be boring.

The TA- Mr. Leung is very patient. He explains the tutorial questions with clear steps and elaboration. Very useful to those who don't understand what's taught in class (a time for you to catch up).
reviews.comment_grading:

WebWork: 10%
Midterm:35%
Final: 65%

Closed book exams.  
I kinda screw the midterm(about mean), but get a high mark for the final (above >1 sd). Got A range in the end
reviews.comment_workload:
WebWork can be difficult to complete on time especially when you are facing multiple quizzes and project deadlines. But as WebWork counts towards 10% of the final grade, it's VERY important.

I would strongly recommend you to buy the book as there are lots of good practice questions for you to test yourself.  (Sadly, only answers of odd number questions will be provided. Thats really cruel haha)

reviews.author: tungcc

reviews.comment_content:
To be honest, I am not good at Math since I didn’t take M1/2 in DSE.
This course mainly focuses on M1/2 stuff which are quite difficult for beginners
reviews.comment_teaching:
He posts all lecture videos on canvas so you can actually skip the lessons and watch his videos at home.
However the TA is not helpful. He just read directly from the notes. The notes are quite hard to understand
reviews.comment_grading: Poorly graded. The mid term grading is normal since everyone does it in lecture halls. However since the final is online and Zoom doesn’t know whether you cheated in MC, the scores for MC are mysteriously high, not evenly distributed comparing to Long Questions

Light. Only need to do the webwork exercises which have unlimited attempts.

reviews.author: recklessrobyn
reviews.title: Questionable teaching quality but generally good grade
reviews.comment_content: Basic calculus. As a DSE student who only took core Math in secondary school, overall the course content was easy to understand. The difficulty of course content will increase as the course progresses.
reviews.comment_teaching:
As mentioned in the title. Ku's English isn't the best, and he speaks very slowly. I ditched lectures from the second week onwards and watched recorded lectures with x2 speed. It was much more efficient than being in class.

But with that said he explains questions, answers and concepts fairly well. He takes the time to write down solutions of in-class questions step by tep in detail, which helps a great deal. The fact that he teaches relatively slowly is a plus for math dummies like me, since it makes it much more easier to follow. However a suggestion to fellow math dummies is do not solely rely on the course materials (textbook, ppt, tutorial etc). It is not enough to help you understand what's going on.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fairly good grade.

As long you complete homework on time (there shouldn't be any problem getting full marks as you can try an infinite number of times before the submission deadline) you will be able to secure full marks (10%) for the assignment part. Midterm accounts for 30% while final accounts for 60%.

The mean for midterm was 34.5/60. For finals it was 26.5/40 for MCQ and 14.4/20 for LQ.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light. Only need to submit homework (problem set of around 15 questions) biweekly (a rough estimate), complete 1 midterm and 1 final exam.

For math dummies, practising by only completing hw sets is not enough. Strongly recommend completing the list of textbook questions which the prof will send you after completing one topic, re-doing homework questions, mock papers and past papers.

reviews.author: alexto6

reviews.comment_teaching: The lecture can just all skip if you are confident with your math skills. reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, his teaching isn't very good. The majority of the lessons are spent reading out directly from the presentation slides. He uploads the slides a day before lessons and you can full access to them without attending the lessons. Attendance rate fell significantly after the week 1, a possible indicator of his reaching performance. However, the low class attendance rate meant that he could entertain a lot of questions after lessons. I stayed behind on many occasions to clarify doubts and problems encountered. He was very patient and did a good job with his explanation. I appreciate that and he should be credited for that.

Mean: 33.4/60
SD: 12.1

reviews.comment_workload:
If you did DSE M1/IB SL mathematics in high school, this course should be a breeze for you and workload would be low. However, if you didn't take M1/ SL math, expect to devote more time into this subject. I would expect some difficulty for students with no prior mathematical background. This course is basically half of SL math/DSE M1 crammed in 3 months so things can get quite challenging if you did not take these courses in high school.

The webwork assignments were quite manageable and could be completed in 1~2 hours. Good luck!

reviews.author: katnam
reviews.comment_content: Easy content. Not difficult for students who have never studied m1m2 before. Just some simple knowledge of d and in.
reviews.comment_teaching: self-study. The professor is useless and just do some simple example in the class. Sometimes, she may write some notes on white board but u cant even see it. Very boring and actually cant understand what she is talking about.

reviews.author: Studdas
reviews.title: Review of MATH 1003
reviews.comment_content:
The content in this course is not bad. It teaches you concepts which can be actually applied in a business environment such as interest, annuity etc.
The differentiation and integration in this course are fairly easy even if you do not have any prior knowledge about them.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Attending the classes are a waste of time. Self-study and using online websites will help you more than attending the class. You will notice that students attended the first 2 weeks and then did not attend classes at all.
The instructor has a thick accent which made it extremely hard to understand him, he just read the slides and solved them on a projected sheet of paper. In my opinion, reading the slides when it is uploaded on canvas is as good as attending the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term Exam - 30% of the grade
Final Exam - 60% of the grade
WebWork (HW uploaded online) - 10% of the grade.

Mid-term and Final exam difficulty is subjective. Students who have done the math before in high school found this course easy, however, students who did not have any math in high school found it fairly difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fairly moderate. WebWork is uploaded every 1 or 2 weeks testing concepts which are taught

reviews.author: Chiakisezz
reviews.title: For students who can strive to self-study maths
reviews.comment_content:
Not too many. The professor just taught 4-5 chapters and some may not be included in exams. I do not have M1 or M2 background but it is still easy for me to study.   
Just do more exercises and be familiar with the forms of questions.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Having lessons in lecture, but you must fall a sleep because of his dull voice. His speaking tone is not quick but unclear, you actually don't know what he is teaching and even writing. (The words he write on whiteboard is very small, hard to see and take photo) You can see it clearly only if you sit at the very front (first three rows maybe) and take photo after lesson. You can ask questions after lesson and he will answer you...(not quite clear too I think)

I think tutorial class is better than lecture since TA is explaining more clear than the professor. Also TA will put some webwork questions in in-class exercises and explain it all together.  For me, I just skipped the lecture and attend tutorial every week.
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork         10%
Midterm exam  30%
Final exam       60%

No attendance will be recorded and included in grading. So you can skip the lessons and self study by his powerpoint and textbook.
Good grading. For exams, mean is not high for both midterm and final. It is slightly higher than pass only.
The professor will give you pastpaper. It is very important since in midterm and final, the long question parts are 60-70% similar to the pastpaper! (If you know how to answer pastpaper, exams will be quite easy for you)

For me, all the contents is self-study.
Webwork : 100/100
Midterm exam: 45/60 (mean:32.6)
Final exam: 93/100 (mean: 57.4)

Just got the exam marks all higher than mean and I finally got A grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Light. There are only 5-6 pieces of webwork during the semester. 10-12 questions for each piece. Some answers can be found on Google and even Youtube. (Only numbers are different but questions is the same) You can try unlimited times until the answer is correct. So it is easy to get full 10%.  Deadline of webwork is not urgent too. The professor will give you 2-3 weeks to complete one piece and submit.

reviews.comment_teaching: As I said, sitting in the lectures does not help at all, as he does not know how to teach, he speaks like a robot with a Chinese accent that is really hard to understand and follow. And if you ask him questions during and after class, he does not answer the questions properly as he does not understand what you're trying to say. I appreciate his effort for trying but you really need to work hard for the grades if you're aiming high. reviews.author: coffeeandtea
reviews.comment_content: Basic application in calculus and algebra are taught in this course. Some topics include derivatives, integration, optimization, matrices, graphing. It is suitable for those who have not studied M1/M2 in the DSE curriculum, or equivalent. Contents might be challenging for some, as it crams ~1 year of M1/2 topics into 1 semester.

Thus, watching the lecture videos in 1.5 times speed during your free time is recommended, as he speaks quite slowly in lectures. Attendance is not required, as long as you understand the course concepts and do all the WebWork, you will be fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is based on a curve, and it is quite competitive. The mean and SD for the midterm and finals are quite high. If you want a good grade you will have to study the syllabus ahead of time, or frequently visit the math support centre to clear any misunderstood concepts.

Median for Midterm: 36 out of 60

s.d. for Finals: 21.6 out of 100

reviews.comment_workload: The workload for this course is fair, as you will only be required to complete 8 WebWork assignments with unlimited attempts within the whole semester. You will only have to take 1 midterm and 1 final examination.

reviews.comment_content:
This course covers 4 main topics: financial mathematics, matrixes, differentiation, and integration. For most of the content in this course, it is possible to self-study it and also learn sample questions from existing past papers.The content is overall quite understandable and will not pose to much of a difficulty for anyone who have prior-knowledge in calculus.

Attendance does not matter at all as it is not calculated towards the grade. MATH1003 is also the very few math courses that has a normal distribution grading scheme.
reviews.comment_teaching:
This is the instructor's first year in teaching at HKUST and he is not very good at delivering the content due to a language barrier. The instructor usually reads off the lecture slides which is derived from the textbook thus you will probably have better luck in understanding the content from reading the textbook yourself. He also make mistakes quite often when doing the examples on the white board.

My class consisted of about 100+ people, however, after the add-drop period, only about 20+ people attended the lecture each time.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% WeBWork - Online Assignments
30% Mid-term
60% Finals

WeBWork is often quite easy to ace as it is possible to google the questions online to find answers. It also consists unlimited trials thus making it easy to get full score. For mid-terms and finals, if you fully study the textbook and past papers, there shouldn't be a big problem in getting a B range or above.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload mainly consisted of WeBWork which was considerably easy, thus does not placed too much pressure on your studies. However, it is advisable to study the content and practice the questions constantly (as mathematics in general needs it) which may take a bit more time.

reviews.author: hungrypotato
reviews.comment_content:
Covers topics such as finances, matrices, derivatives and integration.

Finances is basically calculating interest rates and bank payments (taught in core maths in high school as well). I heard the level of matrices covered in this class is much easier than that taught in extended maths for DSE.

Derivatives and integration is a little more difficult for those who have weaker math background, but the level of difficulty covered for these topics is bearable as long as you work hard and study. The content is extremely useful in studying business in the future years, so I guess the content is still pretty good.
reviews.comment_teaching: Weiping is extremely cute (I think). He is extremely nice and tries to crack jokes even though not many people laugh. I still remember him joking about his finger being lazy because the projector did not respond to him. Anyways, Weiping is extremely patient and does not mind staying after class to answer students' questions. The TAs are also very nice and patient. I didn't quite like the tutor I was assigned, so I just went to another tutorial with a chubby TA. He was amazing! I forgot his name, but you can find him in the Math Support Centre.
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork: 10%
Mid-Term: 30%
Finals: 60%

There are unlimited attempts allowed for webwork questions before the deadline, and the system also tells you if you get the correct answer or not immediately. So usually you can get full mark for this part as long as you don't miss the deadlines.

Mid-term covers finances and matrices. Not too hard if you do the pastpapers posted on Canvas. However, the question types from mid-term and textbooks is slightly different, so I don't suggest doing textbook questions too much. However, one of the long question in mid-term was from the textbook. Should be pretty good grade if you understand the concepts very clearly though.

Final exam was a disaster for many people, but that again, if you do the pastpapers you should be fine. Because the format of the pastpapers is almost THE SAME with finals, many just the MCs and numerical values changed. Just remember to ask around the higher year people for pastpaper resources, since the professor only uploads one or two pastpapers which are not too similar to finals. If you can find pastpapers that the professor did not upload, chances are you are going to get another paper that is extremely similar to finals.

Does not count attendance, so I could skip math tutorials. But math tutorials are extremely useful so don't skip them.
reviews.comment_workload: Almost nothing. Webwork came out every one or two weeks, and the time to complete them is quite long. Some webworks are more difficult, but you can ask the TA after tutorial class and sometimes they do all the calculation for you while teaching you and eventually you do not have to do a lot.
