reviews.comment_teaching: He really explains things quite clearly with a lot of examples, really quite easy to follow
reviews.comment_grading: Dun worry hard work pays off!! I have done all the exercise in the book of all the chapter taught and I performed quite well in the exam. Also there are several sets of past paper provided, so you must do it to familiar with the type of questions. but calculators are not allowed in this course. the mean of mid term is quite high, but the mean for final is quite low less than a half of the total mark.
reviews.comment_workload: You have to finish the webwork. Those questions are more difficult to the examination. However, you must know how to do those webwork questions to get a gd grade. If you dun know how to do so, simply go to math support centre.

reviews.author: Yuki_Lam
reviews.comment_content: The course touches upon concepts of matrix, differentiation and interest rate, etc. which are not too hard, or may even be easy, to most students.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is humorous and makes some funny jokes in the lesson. He teaches very clearly and I can understand most, if not all, of the concepts. He is also flexible and does not rely solely on the powerpoints - he gives alternative solutions during certain points of the lesson. Nice instructor!
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is not bad.
reviews.comment_workload: Basically only webwork. One midterm and one final. Relatively light workload, which should be manageable to most students.

reviews.author: smm
reviews.comment_content: The content of the lecture is relatively easy for freshmen. Some basic knowledge of calculus will be taught.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is a really nice person. It is very kind of her to help me out of some problems I met in the exam. There will be a series of powerpoint for each class.
reviews.comment_grading: Pretty good grade if you have 90+ in both mid-term and final exams.
reviews.comment_workload: There will be 5-6 sets of homework on webwork of math department. They may have some bugs and the tutorial classes will be very helpful if you have any question in the homework.

reviews.author: Chocacho
reviews.comment_content:
Teaches basic mathematical concepts, as the lowest math level course.
Topics include:
Financial math
Matrixs
Calculus with differentiation and integration
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wang Ke is very careful and detailed which can be boring at times but really helps when understanding more complicated concepts.
Lecture slides are shared on canvas and explain the formulas with examples. In class she will go through the slides adding explanations then go through many examples with you. She will had write the steps and project it onto the screen for students to follow.
reviews.comment_grading:
1 Midterm
1 Final non-cumulative
Webwork

Questions in exams are similar to her final examples on slides which are from past exams. Midterm is on financial math and matrix units then final is only on calculus, non-cumulative. She will share past papers for revision before exams

Webwork questions are more difficult than in class examples, can ask tutorial teacher or math help.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload only need to do webworks which are set for each topic. Usually gives around two weeks to complete with unlimited attempts. Simply complete and finish on time to get participation grade.
Textbook is available for practice questions but not used in class

reviews.author: blank_space
reviews.comment_content:
It's ok if you've done IB. Otherwise, GG. :)
First half of semester: interest and matrices.
Second half of semester: differentiation and integration.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Li Weiping tries very hard to make you understand the subject, and to arouse your interest in maths. Not bad given that he knows (and you know) that you're probably never gonna take maths again.

Li Xilin just goes through the worksheets and goes through what Li Weiping covers in class. Decent.
reviews.comment_grading: The mid-term has a super high line curve. 1 SD above mean already beyond full marks. The line curve for the final is more sane.
reviews.comment_workload: Depends on your self-motivation la. The maths support center is your best friend.

reviews.author: Ricky Yim
reviews.comment_content:
The course mainly covers four sections: Matrices, Financial Mathematics, Differentiation and Integration. The Mid-term Exam covers the former two topics; where Finals covers the latter two topics excluding any syllabus covered in the Mid-term examination.
The content is pretty easy for newbies in calculus and statistics: The financial maths covers a couple of formulas that are not too complicated. However, all the content requires a lot of practices to master the steps and treatments for different question types.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not really having a lot of comments on the teaching skills of the lecturer, all I could say is the accent... is pretty hard to follow. The tutor in tutorial sessions is pretty good in terms of explaining the practice questions to us.
reviews.comment_grading:
The overall composition of the course are as followed:
10% Webwork
30% Mid-term
60% Finals
Grades:
Webwork: 800/800 (Mean:758.35/800)
Mid-term: 78/80 (Mean:68.53)
Finals: 152/160 (Mean:82.38)
Overall: 96.25/100 (Mean:66.07/100)
Overall Grade: A+

Tips:
1. Make sure you have finished all the webwork assigned. The last two webwork deadlines are packed together, make sure you don't miss the last one.
2. For beginners in calculus, make sure you make good use fo your time after mid-term to master your skills in differentiation and integration as they are pretty tough for the beginners.
3. Practice really makes perfect, so keep practising. (FYI I finished all the recommended questions from the lecturers)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload required by the course is really quite minimal. Though the webwork question is sometimes a bit tricky ( like the ones that are the very last few questions) but then with infinitely many attempts for all the questions, it is not too hard to attain full score. Seek help from Maths centre if necessary. Symbolab and Wolfram-Alpha might be a good tool to help you finish the earlier question from Webwork but try to finish it yourself as a few extra practices for yourself.

reviews.author: Oscar Wong
reviews.comment_content: This course teaches basic calculus.  Professor Li plan the time well.  All the materials are covered in a suitable speed.  Answer students' questions in a very detailed way.  Sometimes I think it is too detail and uses too much time.  But I admit that every student has different ability so I really appreciate his patience and willingness to teach.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Li is a wonderful professor.  Willing to spend his spare time after lessons answering questions, replies email quickly, gives a lot of reminders before mid-term and final exam.  Maths really requires students to do a lot of practice.  Professor Li mentioned this again and again.  He also provided us some recommended questions.  Those questions save our time finding suitable practice.  2 past papers are provided before mid term and final respectively.  Overall a wonderful professor.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade of this course is curved within ALL classes according to Professor Li.  So that means no matter you are taught by which professor, your grade will not be affected.  I got over 90% in both mid term and final, final grade is A+.  So just work hard and do more practice.  Which class you are in will not affect your grade much since it is curved within ALL classes.
reviews.comment_workload: Just some basic online homework.  Plenty of time for you to do it.  Moreover, no limit in answering the questions.  That means you can try it again and again until you get the correct answer.  You can also ask your friends to do the homework for you (not recommended but you can do so if you are running out of time).  Overall very small workload to me

reviews.author: Sonia
reviews.comment_content: Interest, Matrix, Infinity, Derivatives (Heavy)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Speed of teaching is fine but still need to pay attention in class to catch up
His English is understandable
Includes applications in slides to explain
Tho he only read out the ppt
TA is bad he doesn't know what he is talking about either
Can't understand the TA's English
reviews.comment_grading:
Maybe I am bad at Maths
I didn't get a good grade but I heard many tht this course has fair grading
reviews.comment_workload:
Midterm, Final, 8 Webwork
Fair amount but I hate one webwork per week
Midterm is easy but final is not

reviews.author: Omggggggg
reviews.title: Maths 1003 (not difficult)
reviews.comment_content: This is, perhaps, the easiest maths course in HKUST. The content is rather easy and just a constant review will do. Webwork will also help. Try to finish webwork by yourself so that you can really learn.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher may not cover anything in an in-depth way. And the teacher just directly referred to the notes without further explain how the calculation is done. Yet, students may turn to their tutors for help and they are willing to show how it is done.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading system is fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Apart from webwork, there is no other additional workload. Just make sure you can understand the lecture content by taking a look at the notes on a constant basis.

reviews.author: Takeshikanshiro
reviews.comment_content:
Cover simpler topics such as present value, future value and matrix before the mid term exam.
Cover advanced topics such as derivatives and integration after the mid term exam.
Topics before mid term exam is much more easier to understand whereas topics after that are quite difficult for students that who have never studied similar topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Xiong uses a quite flat tone and follows mainly the examples in the slides. He sometimes show us the calculation step by step on the projector in some advanced topics.
reviews.comment_grading:
30% mid term exam
10% web-work
60% final exam

for the mid term, the mean was 66.xx/80, sd = around 13 to 15

for the final exam, the mean was 80/160, sd = 32
reviews.comment_workload: The workload depends. On average, the workload is fair as you only have to submit web work around twice a week. For students who don't have any calculus background, the workload maybe higher as you might need to practice more to understand the concept and technical know-how of the questions.

reviews.author: lukkk
reviews.comment_content:
-Mathematics of Finance
-Systems of Linear Equations; Matrices
-Limits and the Derivative
-Additional Derivative Topics
-Graphing and Optimization
-Integration
-Additional Integration Topics
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor just read the content on her powerpoint. It was quite unnecessary to attend all the lectures, but I recommend you to learn the graphing by attending the class.
The professor was willing to answer your questions after class and the explanation was clear.
reviews.comment_grading:
-WebWork (10%)
-Midterm (30%), 1.5 hours
-Final Exam (60%), 3 hours
I finished all the webwork questions, got 80/80 in the midterm and 144/160 in final. I got 94% in total and an A+.
Here is some extra information for you:
The mean of midterm exam is 68.6.
For final, it is 89.9.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload was light and all you need to do were just finishing your webwork on time and attending the exams.
However, some questions in webwork might be quite challenging. If you are a deadline fighter, you may not have enough time to finish your webwork.

reviews.author: kiwifruit
reviews.title: Hard Work Pays Off :)
reviews.comment_content: I dropped M2 when I was F.5 and many of the topics taught in this course are covered in HKDSE M2, including differentiation and integration (these topics are taught after midterm), I think that the content here is more straightforward than that of M2 and it was quite easy to follow though I thought that I would screw up as I experienced failure in my M2. The geometric sequence and matrix taught before midterm will be fine if u do enough exercises.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is hard for a math teacher not to read allow the ppt when teaching, so I think her teaching is fine because she explained the concepts clearly though the teaching pace is quite fast. Sometimes she provides detailed steps or notes which are not shown on the ppt and those notes are quite useful. The TA is also good and is willing to answer questions but the tutorial's pace is much slower so if u have already understood the concepts in lectures u may not need to attend the tutorials. No attendance required for both lecture and tutorial.
reviews.comment_grading: Good. My scores of midterm and final are higher than the mean. As final exam weighs 60% of your grade, it is very important to score better in the final. The final mean is 89/160 and I scored 13X/160 and finally, I got an A. Remember to work on the questions recommended by the prof in the textbook, it helps a lot !!!
reviews.comment_workload: Approximate 8 webwork assignments to finish throughout the whole course and remember to get full marks for all of them as u can try as many times as you can without marks being deducted. 1 midterm 1 final, again, if you want to score high please remember to finish the textbook questions.

reviews.author: ducky
reviews.title: Very good Prof
reviews.comment_content: Interest(present/future value,annuity), matrics, calculus(limit, differentiation and integration)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Weiping teaches well. Usually, there are very few steps in the lecture notes so it is hard for students to solve by themselves. However, he explains each question in the lecture notes on the board. So students can easily follow and do revision after class. He is passionate and willing to answer questions from students. Occasionally tell some jokes in the class and encourage students to do more exercise. The atmosphere in the class is also good, the majority of students pay attention to his lecture and jot notes (some take pictures). But his class is at 9 am, so not many students will attend the lecture.
Especially recommend this prof to those who are not good at maths and aim high in this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
0% participation
10% webwork
30%(1.5hr) Midterm
60%(3hr) Final Exam
All students of this course will take the same midterm and final exam paper. The grading of this course depends on the performance of all students of this course, regardless of the prof.
This course is for students who do not have M1/M2 backgrounds. So it is fair as the starting point is nearly the same. Students can get a good grade (A/B grade) by doing exercise and adequate revision.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy. No attendance. There is 8 webwork required. Some questions in webwork are difficult. Students can skip all lessons and get A grade. But for students who are not good at math, have to do many exercises in textbook and webwork to get a better grade. Some questions in exams are similar or even the same in textbook.

reviews.author: economist
reviews.title: Weiping - An excellent Professor
reviews.comment_content: I Chapter 3. Mathematics of Finance (3.1-3.4) I Chapter 4. Systems of Linear Equations; Matrices (4.1-4.7) I Chapter 10. Limits and the Derivative (10.4-10.5) I Chapter 11. Additional Derivative Topics (11.1-11.7) I Chapter 12. Graphing and Optimization (12.1-12.2, 12.4-12.6) I Chapter 13. Integration (13.1-13.2, 13.4-13.5) I Chapter 14. Additional Integration Topics (14.1-14.3)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Li Wei Ping is a great professor who illustrates examples clearly in lectures and his lecture notes are well-constructed and easy-to-understand. Go to his lectures on time.If you have questions, just go to ask him by email or meet him in person. He is willing to answer patiently. P.S. I nearly sent over 20 emails to ask him during final exam period.

Tutorials can actually skipped if you really pay attention in lecture. My tutor is Liu Ping which is a very kind big boy. But professor teaching is much better, so I usually find Prof. Li.
reviews.comment_grading:
HW 10 percent
Mid-term 30 percent
Final 60 percent
_____________
Mine
Hw Full marks
Mid-term Full marks
Final 137/160
Total: 91.38/100 --> A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Only webwork
Suggest to do as many pastpaper as you can as final is much difficult. Doing pp will give you advantage as some questions will repeat.
Practice makes perfect!!!
Add oil!!!

reviews.author: matthew369
reviews.comment_content:
Financial Math
Matrix
Calculus
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is bad, the lecturer only reads powerpoints.
There is no reason to attend the class if you are good at math.
Read powerpoints are enough for you to understand what is happening.
Doing exercises is the key to a better grade, so you should really put times into it.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% webwork
30% midterm (only 1) mean=62.36/80
60% final  mean=86.18/160

overall mean: 64.85%
I got an A with overall 83%
As long as you perform well in final exam, your grade will be decent
reviews.comment_workload:
only webwork is required
questions in webwork are not really that hard
but it is very time-consuming

reviews.author: Polaris
reviews.comment_content:
Fundamental course of Calculus. Extremely fast-paced course for Newbies.
Ch.1 Interests
Ch.2 Time value of Money
Ch.3 Linear Equation in two unknown
Ch.4-7 Manipulation of Matrices
Ch.8 Application of Matrices
Ch.10-11 Function and Graph and Limits
Ch.12-13 Basic Differentiation
Ch.14 Implicit Differentiation and Related Rates
Ch.15 Local Extrema
Ch.16 Second Derivative Test and Curve Sketching
Ch.17-18 Global Extrema and Optimization
Ch.19 Antiderivatives
Ch.20-22 Definite Integrals and Area between curves
Ch.23 Application of Integration
Ch.24 Integration by Parts
reviews.comment_teaching:
She actually just read from the powerpoints and you could skip her lessons if you are smart enough, some tricky question and certain techniques would be explained in class, willing to answer questions, her English is decent too.
Attending tutorial is recommended, as a revision of syllabus and actually could get answer of the WEBWORK as well.
Those tutors are quite qualified.
reviews.comment_grading:
No attendance is recorded.
This year something had changed.
8 webworks : 10%
1 midterm : 30% (note that 2016-2017 had 2)
Final : 60%
It is a highly competitive course, cliche "practise makes perfect." is applicable here. Midterm is relatively simple this year and the mean mark is quite high like 69/80.
96% in total is an A+
reviews.comment_workload:
8 webworks this year
1 midterm and a final
It is said different from 2016-2017 fall MATH 1003
actually you have to practise a lot, apart from those assigned questions in the textbook, you have to do extra.
It depends.

reviews.author: jdub___
reviews.title: A Practical Maths Course
reviews.comment_content: Interest rates, matrices, differentiation and integration topics. This course is for local students who haven't studied M1/M2 in the DSE curriculum and non-local students who haven't studied differentiation and integration in high school, so its crucial to have the initiative to do the exercises in the textbook, or else you'll have a hard time in the mid-term and final.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Li was quite a nice professor; he would encourage us to ask questions whenever we had any problems. He would also crack jokes occasionally and write things on the whiteboard to motivate us. However, the response from the students was rather subdued, maybe because it was a 9am lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
As most of the students hadn't learnt matrices, differentiation and integration during high school (some students might have but dropped the subject during high school), you could imagine quite closely-distributed scores and relatively high means during both the mid-term and final. So that's why you should do more exercises and ask whenever you have any questions during the course, as basically everyone is on the same starting line as you.

Online Homework (WeBWorK): 10%
Quizzes and attendance: 0%
One 1.5-hour Midterm Exams: 30%    
One 3-hour Final Exam: 60%
reviews.comment_workload: We had to complete WeBWork for 8 times during the semester,  which is online homework for maths courses. You  have unlimited attempts at each question, but you have to complete each WeBWork by the specified deadline. Other than that, there is nothing to do for the course, except for doing exercises as i mentioned earlier.

reviews.author: thyc0309_
reviews.title: I didn't work hard enough so the grade was bad
reviews.comment_content:
Before midterm:
Financial Maths (Present & Future Value of an Annuity)
Matrices (including inverse, gauss-jordan elimination and leontief input-output analysis)

After midterm:
Calculus:
- Limits and continuity
- Basic differentiation
- Chain rule and implicit differentiation
- Curve sketching; absolute maxima and minima
- Optimization
- Integration: by substitution, indefinite and definite integrals, area under curves (Riemann sums)
- Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
- Integration by parts
reviews.comment_teaching:
Just reading the ppt slides, very easy to fall asleep
However she explains the steps in solving problems quite in detail and clear
The TA is quite useful in teaching actual problem-solving skills and he explains complicated concepts quite okay
reviews.comment_grading:
10% WeBWork
30% Midterm
60% Final

For me:
Midterm: 74/80 (mean 66.89)
Final: 72/160 (mean 82)
Final grade: B-
I should have worked much harder...
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload, the WeBWork problems are not too hard to handle, but some do require high-level mathematical deduction
However, to get a good grade, you ought to practice regularly by doing problems in the textbook and remember the approaches and steps
Revise as many question types as possible for the midterm and final

reviews.author: Abhishek
reviews.comment_content: This course covers financial maths, matrices, and calculus (differentiation and integration). Very basic. Unless you are a business student (I think its compulsory for them), I would recommend you to take pure calculus courses like Calculus 1.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is very good, but mostly reads from the ppt. She is quite helpful after class from what I heard, I personally have never contacted her for any doubts.
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork 10%
Mid term exam 1 - 25%
Mid term exam 2 - 25%
Final exam - 40%
I think the grading is satisfactory.
reviews.comment_workload: Apart from the regular webwork, it is quite light.

reviews.author: Pyhui
reviews.comment_content:
powerpoint既theory同Q&A岩睇易明易跟
不過Ans既tricky位冇乜詳解
reviews.comment_teaching:
少少快
講既寫既同powerpoint一樣
所以基本上可以自己去canvas睇哂
唔會叫學生答問題 自己由上堂講到落堂
自由度高 所以課室少嘈
reviews.comment_grading: 正常 唔係killer
reviews.comment_workload:
題數唔多 想清多啲concept要去做extra練習
記分既功課佔分唔重 大部分係考試

reviews.author: Naeun
reviews.comment_content:
He explains each sample questions step by step.
Sometimes also explains the online questions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Boring if you know the content. You can study yourself. It is okay to use phone and laptop as long as you don't disturb him.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute Grading.
Easy to get an A in this course if you know all the concept and do the online questions.
reviews.comment_workload: Normal workload. Around 1 assignments per 1.5 weeks. ~10 questions and only the last two or three is a little bit difficult. But you can ask the TA at Maths Center. It also counts into the grade of the course.

reviews.author: Fina真係好辛·苦．
reviews.comment_content: differentiaton+matrix+integration+financial maths
reviews.comment_teaching: fall sem第一堂就係上呢個prof,本身個人都算nice,落堂問野佢都好肯答,但係你未必會聽得明.上堂會盡量同學生一齊做數,亦都會講解下數既theory.我本身中學有讀m2但係drop左,個course既野普通學晒,但係當佢講到theory都係完全聽唔明,如果無m1 m2底既就唔好reg啦
reviews.comment_grading: 踩mean大概B-如果整體都高1個sd就可以a range .我平均高1.5個sd最後拎A+,但係唔知個GRADE分prof拉定點.Xiong 個lecture低分過其他lecture好多,次次midterm final個mean都低其他lecture好幾分 我final 93/105 另一個fd 103/105都係同grade.
reviews.comment_workload: 呢個course 既workload就睇自己想唔想靚grade.淨係計佢規定要做既野就好少.webwork 係佢每次教緊一part都會出,可以無限attempt,所以只要準時做好就得,剩低計分既就只有midterm同final.如果想靚grade可以做晒書d 練習,甘樣workload就會好重.如果想安心拎個b range,呢個course workload都算幾低

reviews.author: Morgan
reviews.title: 2016-2017 Fall
reviews.comment_content:
First Half:
- Financial Mathematics (Present Value, Future Value, FV and PV of an Annuity etc.)
- Systems of Linear Algebra
- Matrices
- Functions and Graphs

Second Half:
- Derivatives
- Optimization
- Integration
//+ any other basic concepts within these.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professors are generally okay and use powerpoints to teach. These powerpoints are important to look over after class. The classes are quite large, so aim to sit nearer to the front where you'll be able to ask questions.

I would advise you to attend all of the tutorial sessions, which I find useful, as it can help understand the mathematics concepts more.
reviews.comment_grading:
If you revise and ensure that you get 100% in all of the web works (which mostly everyone does) on a regular basis, you should be able to get a decent to good grade.
There are two midterms which are both 25% of the final grade. Make sure you do well in these because the final is much harder. A calculator can only be used in the first mid term. And make sure you learn the equations that will not be given on the exam.

Note: This course requires constant practice and revision to score well.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload includes WebWork quizzes (every week or two), 2 mid terms + 1 final exam. The exams generally get harder as they go.
If you have any issues, you can either ask the professors questions or seek guidance from the Math Support Centre.

The WebWork is not that hard and the majority mostly get 100%, so make sure you answer each question correctly, as you get as many attempts as you want.

All in all, the workload is not too bad. Just make sure you do the WebWork early as some questions take longer than expected.

reviews.author: LamHoHo
reviews.comment_content: it is a complusory course. it will be no big deal if you try to get help from your friends who are familiar with M1 or M2 maths
reviews.comment_teaching: She is a new instructor. Her lessons are quite boring, but she is kind of helping students after classes.
reviews.comment_grading: Actually, it depends on your classmates. But most likely, it will not be a big deal even if you start revision just few days before.
reviews.comment_workload: regular webwork, most of the questions are easier than textbook. Get help from MSC(math support center)

reviews.author: justsmile
reviews.comment_content: The course covers financial maths, matrices, and calculus (differentiation and integration). Content covered by all professors is the same.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Wang is super nice and approachable. She just teaches based off powerpoint slides, just like all the other teachers. I found her teaching speed a bit fast, but probably all the professors are like that too, so nothing against her. She doesn't take attendance, so a lot of people didn't bother showing up, but I found class useful because she provides additional tips and working on top of what is illustrated on the powerpoint slides.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading curve with all the other Math 1003 students.

Webwork 10%
Mid term exam 1 - 25%
Mid term exam 2 - 25%
Final exam - 40%
reviews.comment_workload: The actual official workload isn't that high. Just make sure you complete your webworks on time. Webwork can be attempted as many times as you want, so you essentially have a free 10%. Just make sure you keep up with your independent revision, because the course pace is quite fast in comparison to high school (obviously).

reviews.author: itsok
reviews.comment_content: It covers the calculation of interests, matrix, limits and derivation. Not difficult. Just follow the powerpoint and do it step by step.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her voice is quite small and her pronunciation is sometimes not clear. She only reads out what is said on powerpoint so actually it is not a must to attend her lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: Quite good. I was above mean for more than 1 sd in the 2 midterms and above mean 0.5 sd for the final exam. Although I score a zero in one of the webwork assignments since I forgot to do it, I got an A in overall.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light. You are required to finish no more than 10 webwork assignments. No quiz during class for WANG, Ke.

reviews.author: Kerozero
reviews.title: Nice Professor with clear explanation
reviews.comment_content: Actually the content will not vary a lot from other professors. However, his explanation is clear and easy to understand for those who have not touched extended module (M1 or M2) in DSE.
reviews.comment_teaching: Some of my friends said that his english is not that good to understand. However, as long as you have adapt the way he speak, his explanation and teaching is so good to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: If you complete the additional questions suggested by him, you will have high chance of getting A range in this course. It is all about your hard-work. You should get resonable return from these light exercise.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload but need to spend time on doing exercise suggested by him (1 hour per week)

reviews.author: UncleDrew

reviews.comment_grading: As I have mentioned, this course will be easy for those who have studied mathematics extended module before. Therefore it is easy to get good grade. Even if you are not that good in mathematics, I am sure professor Li will help you understand the content of this course.

reviews.author: CCLemon
reviews.comment_content: The start of the semester was on Linear Algebra including things most people should have learned in high school like matrices etc. After the first midterm we began to learn more about derivatives and antiderivatives.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ms.Wang teaches at an average to slightly fast pace. Sometimes she glosses over steps such as simplification of equations which might be confusing if you're not paying attention. But she will always clarify if you raise your hand and ask her so don't hesitate. She will also take time after class to help you if you need extra assitance. I spent some time at her office before midterms and the final exam and she was very patient and helpful. She does her best to make sure all her students are prepared for the exams and is always willing to help anyone who seeks it.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is typical standard in HKUST. There will be a pretty large curve due to the varying capabilities of the students in this class. Our final exam average was aroud 60% so as long as you are near that range you should be good. Webwork is pretty much a free 10% so make sure you do all the webworks on time and you should be good to go.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload, for each chapter of the class there are a few webwork questions like all math classes. Nothing you can't handle if you follow along in class and go over the ppts in your spare time. If you do encounter an especially difficult question you can always stay after lectures and ask Ms.Wang or visit her during her office hours and she will be happy to help you.

reviews.author: emilie
reviews.comment_content: Chapters are related and it is quite helpful for business students. It could be challenging for some students but it is not hard if you attend class.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor reads off from the power point. Provides extra problems that students can practice. She is nice and kind, always willing to answer extra questions or help.
reviews.comment_grading: Professor does not mark the exam but when there are problems during paper check, she is willing to remark the problem.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 8 Webworks and it is doable in given amount of time. But there are two midterms, which needs good preparation.

reviews.author: Isabelle
reviews.comment_content: I think you basically learn the exact same thing no matter who is your instructor.  They actaully use the same powerpoint in teaching.  The things they taught are same basic concepts of how maths can apply on economic issues as well, which I found them quite interesting and useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is kind of useless I would say.  The instructor spoke too soft and always make mistakes while explaining.  Sometimes she didn't even realised she was wrong until some student reminded her.  But I personally think you don't need a good instructor to ace this subject, you just need to read through all PowerPoint, excercise and homework is good enough.  Or find someone good at maths to carry you.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair.  拉curve.  I got above at least one SD for both midterms, full marks for all homework, but did so bad in my final that i think I'm 1.5 SD below mean.  Just few percentage away in getting A-.
reviews.comment_workload: 8 homework in total, each with 8-14 questions.  Kind of piece of cake.  If find one of the question too difficult and basically just ask some M1/2 friends.

reviews.author: Ale x
reviews.comment_content: The content is fine as it is not too difficult to pick up. But there is really so much things to learn and sometimes will mess them up.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is not good as she will just repeat the lecture notes once without making theories and calculation easier. She always does some questions again which are actually included in lecture notes in the lecture. It is quite time-consuming and meaningless.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Webwork

25% mid-term exam 2

reviews.comment_workload: Only need to finish excercises on Webwork timely. No other stuff like assignment to hand in.

reviews.author: poisonous
reviews.comment_content:
mid-term 1:
financial maths&matrix
mid-term 2:

limits&differentiation&integration

reviews.comment_teaching:
lecturer上堂剩係將ppt既野抄一次落白板，講解就咁讀一次definition咁，最多就係示範example同step by step咁講一題數點做。如果本身識/有預習都可能跟到既，但對完全唔識既人(大部分學生)嚟講根本冇可能聽得明。同埋佢啲大陸口音既英文好難聽，講經咁既tone仲要好多字會聽唔明。個人覺得上堂都冇用所以走左好多。
呢個lecturer既tutor係leung ho ming，香港人，最好就係落堂可以用廣東話問佢野。上堂係用英文(因為有外國學生)，主要都係step by step解數，叫做有用過上lecture，可以通返啲concept。不過因為tutor一星期先一堂仲要慢過lecture既進度，所以如果已經學識左concept可能會覺得悶，搵人幫手拎tutor notes都ok。
reviews.comment_grading:
webwork 10%
midterm1 25%
midterm2 25%
final 40%
算好掛，多勞多得既course。
overall above mean 0.71sd有A-
reviews.comment_workload: 2-3個星期一份webwork同埋唔洗交既有weekly practice。workload不大但如果要考得好真係要操數，所以都幾多野做。老實講跟呢個lecturer既話用上堂既時間嚟操數好過，間唔中去上吓睇吓佢進度去到邊同埋臨考midterm去聽佢講範圍就夠。佢會upload ppt同埋weekly practice(textbook exercise)，要搵人攞ebook。

reviews.author: TC
reviews.title: Good grades for math course
reviews.comment_content:
Three key topics:
1) Financial Math (L1-L4)
2) Basic Matrix (L5- L12)
(fist mid-term coverage)

3) Basic Calculus,
including limit, differentiation: (second mid-term coverage)
integration
(final exam only covers calculus items)

The content will be covered in the first mid-term test is quite easy, so basically you can read the note all by your own.
However, once the calculus part started, I think it is better for you to start to catch up all the stuff asap.
Normally speaking, students who would take this course should have no idea with calculus. However, the teaching speed of this course is quite fast. I recommend that you may borrow a M1 book from your friends to do some exercises in order to get a better grade!
reviews.comment_teaching:
Erm...
I think her teaching is fair, but not quite satisfactory.
Basically just read out the note, and copy those steps listed on the notes in the whiteboard ...
But I do think she is willing to help students and she answers  email efficiently!
reviews.comment_grading:
Personally I think the grading is pretty good.
Take myself as example.
First mid-term: 71/80
Second mid-term: 49/80
Final exam: 62/105
Web-work: 100%

I was surprised that I can obtain B+ in this course :O)
As I only performed well in the first mid-term, but performed quite bad in the following two test/exam, particularly for my second mid-term test.

For the difficulties of each test/exam:
First mid-term: easiest among 3 test/exam, what you need to do is to remember formula and do some exercises
Second mid-term: slightly hard compared to first mid-term, you should prepare well, I mean every single item in order get a good result (the reason why I performed so badly in the test is I just skipped some topics but they appeared in the test :O)
Final exam: VERY VERY VERY difficult. Basically the past paper is useless. I can score more than 80% for the past paper, but can only score ~ 60% in the real paper. 9 MCs and 3 Long questions. Seems that the paper is that long, right? But the fact is, every MC required lots of calculations to get the answer. And each MC weights quite a lot (5 mark each, so you needa be careful). Long question part: part a,b for each LQ is not difficult, but it turned to another level when comes to part c,d.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is light:
Three items for this courses:
1) mid-terms * 2 (25% each)
2) webwork* 8 (10% total)
3) final exam (40%)

reviews.author: helpme
reviews.title: Good..?
reviews.comment_content: As a person who never learned Calculus before, the lecture contents were very enlightening - this lecture taught me why business students should learn calculus.  Besides calculus, the financial math part was also very interesting to me because the contents were very practical and useful.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very nice, she is very eager to help her students improve their math skills. However, I think she lacks of charisma as a professor, so the fellow students did not really pay much attention to her lecture.

TA: Leung Ho Ming
Not sure of what other TAs did, but he used a 'spoon-feeding' method to teach his students. It might sound negative, but I am pretty sure that this teaching method is better for people who never learned the contents before.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is satisfactory because the hard work pays of for this class.

The first two midterms were fine (except the fact that one of the long questions for the first midterm was just messed up). However, you better continue your hard work even after you obtain a good grade on the midterms, because the final exam is just crazy.
reviews.comment_workload: The 'workload' is not heavy at all; just a set of webwork every 2 to 3 weeks. Well, in terms of preparing for exams, it was extremely heavy probably because I never learned these contents before.

reviews.author: human.mystery
reviews.comment_content:
- Financial math
- Matrices
- Diffrentiation and integration

The matrices taught was basic. But it takes some time to get the idea. But if you did IGCSE math, I remember touching on it.
Did IB Math SL so differentiation and integration was an ok topic for me.
reviews.comment_teaching:
In the beginning, he constantly read off powerpoints. Really didn't like that. He was aware that students were unhappy so he made changes to his teaching style. Overall I would say he's teacher who cares about his students but I personally didn't really respond well to his teaching style. I guess it depends on you. Generally, I felt the tutorials were more helpful. Not everyone would agree but I suggest finding what fits you best.

He uploads powerpoints and question on his website. But I prefer doing the recommended questions from the textbook and the tutorial exercises.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fair. I believe the mean was B. Overall if you get mean the grade is pretty high.

reviews.author: jessica_lps
reviews.title: A compulsory lan grade course
reviews.comment_content: In fact, the basic content for this course is quite useful on business studies, especially for those who have never learnt about calculus. They can all be applied to solve some economical problems.

reviews.comment_grading: As this course is compulsory to all business students who never take M1/M2 during their secondary school, it is difficult to avoid being "wuk gei". reviews.comment_workload: There is only several online homework which can even find maths support center for help to do so it does not really require a lot of time to finish its assignments.

reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fair. Be wary though that the midterm mark actually matters too. The quizzes in class are an easy way to slightly increase your grade, but they won't save you if you screw up everything else.
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork is not too difficult and the course does not require much work IF you have any past experience in calculus. The business/finance mathematics part requires a lot of memorization of formulas, I think even more so than the calculus part.

reviews.author: Dreamscometrue
reviews.title: Basic maths for business
reviews.comment_content: Basic maths including financial maths, matrices, calculus
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nothing to say at all, he just read out the powerpoint and sometimes copy it once.

reviews.author: Inez

reviews.comment_grading: Most of the students have high marks and therefore you have to be careful in the exams~I think that it is not really hard to get a good grade in MATH 1003 as the quality of students is similar. What you have to do is work hard.

reviews.author: LeoLibra107
reviews.title: The Easiest Math Course in UST
reviews.comment_content:
MATH1003 is the easiest mathematics course in UST.

It consist four major parts - Financial Mathematics, Matrices, Differential and Integration.

For 2015/16 Fall, midterm 1 would be financial + matrices. Midterm 2 would be differentiation while final will focus more on integration but there are some questions from previous parts since it is cumulative.

Financial Mathematics and Matrices are easy. Pay attention in class and do sufficient practices will help in midterm. Differentiation and Integration would be more difficult especially for people who never learn it before. It requires some basic understanding of limits (urghhh I never understand it) to do well but you can keep doing those textbook practices until you are familiar with the questions.

And yes, some webwork questions were super hard but I asked my seniors to solve it lol. Sometimes you can solve it by using online calculators (eg mathway).

Textbook is useful. Get one and do the exercises.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Xiong is a good professor. You can feel that he cares about the students. I think all math1003 prof are really nice so it's the same no matter you're in which class. However, I always slept in his class so...

I only attended my tutorial once because the TA speaks with a strong Hong Kong accent and the class is too early lol.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz          -  5%
Webwork  - 10%
Midterm 1 - 25%
Midterm 2 - 25%
Final         - 35%

There are 5 quizzes throughout the course and normally there will be 2 or 3 questions from the recent chapter. You will get half of the marks for attendance so it's not that important lol.

Basically the midterms are as important as the final so you must do well for both midterms if you wanna get an A-range grade.

I don't think the grading is harsh because it is not that hard to get an A-range grade compared to the other courses (this course is my grade saviour for this semester lol).

Midterm 1 - 79/80 (higher 1 sd)
Midterm 2 - 55/80 (around mean)
Final         - 95/100 (higher 1 sd)

Total 88% out of 100.

My marks for all papers are as above and I got an A for my final grade because I screwed my midterm 2 (yes I hate differentiation it was so damn difficult lol). Guess you need to get higher 1 sd for all papers in order to get an A+ for final grade.

I don't think it is not that easy to fail this course unless you really don't study at all ;P

reviews.author: PPBBB
reviews.title: A good common core course for students without calculus background
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course are easy to understand and is suitable for undergraduates who did not take any calculus course before. Things like differentiation and integration would appear in the course but they were not being to go very deep.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor used a lot of examples to illustrate difficult concepts and she provided many resources such as past paper examinations and mini-lecture questions to us in order to let us have a better understanding of mathematics. Tutorial sections were also provided.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading system is quite fair, you can get an A in this course if and only if you pay attention to her classes as well as spend more time on doing extra practices provided by the professor.
reviews.comment_workload: In my opinion, the workload was not too heavy. As all the exercises are not compulsory, except for the eight assignments on WebWork. There were two midterms and one final. Some may think that it was quite harsh. Attendance was not counted by the professor but I recommend you to attend most of her lessons.

financial math, matrix, differentiation, integration etc

reviews.comment_teaching:
i did attend most of professor xiong's lectures but i only attend few math tutorials (kitty)

prof xiong usually explains the examples in the power points and sometimes gives us time to do practice questions on our own and then give further explanation. however i think the pace of the lecture is a bit too fast for calculus beginners without m1 or m2 in their previous studies

for math tutorial, i think that kitty teaches really fast and i could not catch up with what she is talking about so i recommend skipping kitty's math tutorial and sit the tutorials of other TAs.
reviews.comment_grading:
i think the grading is quite good and fair.

mid term 1: below mean 3/4 sd
mid term 2: above 1 sd
final: above mean 1/2 sd
webwork: 100%

total ~70% b range
reviews.comment_workload:
2mid terms 1final and regular webwork

2mid terms: 8-10 MCs and 3-4 long questions

finals: 8-10 MCs 3-4 long questions but more demanding

webwork: questions similar to materials taught in class, unlimited tries until you score 100%
do spare more time to do weekly revision, practice exercise and webwork and this will secure you a b range at least

and lastly no attendance taking (lectures skipping not recommended as i think it is quite useful)
